arts.ttl: Giovanni Manna: ‘Inter and Atalanta superior to Napoli’
arts.sum: Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna shared his thoughts ahead of the crucial match against Inter Milan, emphasizing the competitive landscape of Serie A. Speaking to DAZN, Manna reaffirmed the club’s commitment to their initial goals, stating, “We have been consistent with our initial message; the president reiterated it. We are focused on our daily work. It’s a beautiful league, and the level is rising as we can see in European competitions. We want to be worthy of this wonderful stage.” When asked about the need for a strong performance against Inter, Manna responded, “We must remain focused and positive, managing The post Giovanni Manna: ‘Inter and Atalanta superior to Napoli’ appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Roma crisis deepens with loss to Bologna and Juric fired. Atalanta and Fiorentina join Napoli at top
arts.sum: Roma announced shortly after the game that Juric had been fired, marking the club’s second coaching change this season. Atalanta and Fiorentina both won to move level on points with Serie A leader Napoli, which visits defending champion Inter Milan later Sunday.

arts.ttl: Atalanta manager Gian Piero Gasperini on Marten de Roon’s performance versus Udinese: “He is my coach on the pitch”
arts.sum: Serie A side Atalanta picked up a 2-1 win over Udinese and they went tied at the top of the table. La Dea manager Gian Piero Gasperini lauded Marten de…

arts.ttl: Atalanta’s Injury woes deepen as Zappacosta, Djimsiti, and Zaniolo exit match
arts.sum: Atalanta’s injury crisis has taken another turn for the worse following their match against Udinese. Despite securing a 2-1 victory, the Bergamo-based club saw three key players forced off the pitch due to various injuries. Sky Sport Italia report how the troubles began before kickoff when manager Gian Piero Gasperini learned that Charles De Ketelaere and Sead Kolasinac would be unavailable for the match. However, the situation deteriorated further during the game as Berat Djimsiti, Davide Zappacosta, and Nicolò Zaniolo all succumbed to injuries. Zappacosta was the first to leave the field, suffering from a muscular issue in his left The post Atalanta’s Injury woes deepen as Zappacosta, Djimsiti, and Zaniolo exit match appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Udinese fury: Nani slams VAR decision on Hien’s handball and disallowed goal
arts.sum: Udinese’s technical director Gianluca Nani expressed his frustration with the officiating in their 2-1 loss to Atalanta, particularly focusing on two controversial decisions. Speaking after the match at the Gewiss Stadium, Nani stated, “I expect a book of apologies from the Italian Referees Association. Even from the stands, I noticed Hien’s handball. How can VAR not see it? It was obvious, why didn’t they spot it? Atalanta deserves compliments, they can win the Scudetto, and kudos to our boys too. I would have liked to have that penalty…” The incident in question occurred in the first half when, during a The post Udinese fury: Nani slams VAR decision on Hien’s handball and disallowed goal appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Atalanta 2-1 Udinese: Match Report
arts.sum: Atalanta continued their impressive run of form with a hard-fought 2-1 comeback victory against Udinese, propelling them to the top of the Serie A table. This marks their sixth consecutive win in the league, following recent successes against Napoli and Stuttgart in domestic and European competitions respectively. The match began with both teams creating early chances, with goalkeepers Maduka Okoye and Marco Carnesecchi called into action. Atalanta thought they had taken the lead through Mateo Retegui, but the goal was disallowed due to Ademola Lookman’s offside position. arts.ttl: Serie A Liveblog inc Inter-Napoli, Roma-Bologna, Atalanta-Udinese

arts.sum: Udinese have won 27 Serie A matches against Atalanta (D28, L25): only against Cagliari have the Friuliani collected more wins (28) in the top-flight. Atalanta have scored 29 goals in Serie A this season: only Bayern Munich (32) and Barcelona (40) have netted more in the big five European leagues in 2024/25.
